title: Enterprise & Government Digital Platforms
impactLine: Delivered multiple large-scale platforms compliant with strict government digital service standards.
problem: Delivering complex, content-heavy enterprise platforms that needed to integrate deeply with legacy CMS systems (Sitefinity, Sitecore) while meeting modern performance benchmarks and strict government accessibility/security compliance.
constraints: Strict compliance with Singapore Government Digital Service Standards (DSS).
Seamless integration with enterprise CMS backends.
High maintainability requirements for long-term vendor support.

decisions.title: Component-Driven CMS Integration
decisions.why: Decoupled frontend components from CMS templates to allow independent development and testing cycles while maintaining visual consistency.

decisions.title: Accessibility-First Development
decisions.why: Enforced WCAG 2.1 AA standards at the component level to minimize compliance audit failures during UAT.

architecture.overview: A hybrid architecture leveraging enterprise CMS for content management, serving headless or decoupled frontend interfaces built with modern JavaScript frameworks to ensure interactivity and performance.

implementationNotes: Created shared frontend component libraries to ensure consistency across different government agencies.
Implemented rigorous build pipelines to bake in security headers and asset optimization.
results: Successfully launched multiple high-traffic government portals.
Passed strict third-party security and accessibility audits with minimal remediation.
tradeoffs: CMS integration limits some flexibility in frontend routing and state management compared to pure SPA architectures.
nextImprovements: Explore modern Jamstack approaches with Headless CMS capability to further decouple the presentation layer.
